stories.text: Many countries outside the US rely on WhatsApp for communication. I imagine even a few hours of non-communication wouldnâ€™t be good for the economy or emergency services.
stories.title: Ask HN: How many lives have been negatively affected by WhatsApp going down?

stories.text:
Over here[0] was some tin-hat speculation that FB might use the outage as a distraction while they wiped data from their systems to cover evidence of their many, many infelicities. Immediately readers assumed that it's being suggested that the outage was being created to do this.

That was never suggested. It was not suggested that the outage was instigated for the purpose of creating the cover, merely that it could be, might be, used as a cover.

I'd hope people would have a rational discussion about the question and the issues, the possibilities and the probabilities, but the submission has been flagged. Fair enough. What drives me to distraction is people not reading what's actually said, and instead reacting to something that wasn't said. I honestly expected better of the HN community.

I guess I was wrong.

[0] https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=28752413
stories.title: People reacting to what wasn't said
